predictions.text: The S&P 500 index will close at or above 7,200 on at least one U.S. trading day by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if official S&P Dow Jones Indices data (or widely cited market data sources) show an S&P 500 daily close >= 7200.00 on or before 2026-03-31 (UTC).
evidence: S&P 500 reached 7,000, indicating strong momentum and broader participation (MarketWatch, 2026-01-29).
monitoring_signals: Daily S&P 500 close levels and breadth (advance/decline, equal-weight performance).
Changes in Fed rate-cut pricing (SOFR futures) and real yields.
Earnings revisions and margin commentary from megacaps vs. cyclicals
predictions.rationale: A fresh breakout to 7,000 suggests trend-following flows and improving breadth; a further ~3% move to 7,200 within two months is plausible but sensitive to rates and earnings.

predictions.text: In Microsoft’s FY2026 Q3 earnings release/call (quarter ending 2026-03-31), Microsoft will report 'Azure and other cloud services' revenue growth (constant currency) of 25% or lower.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if Microsoft’s FY2026 Q3 earnings materials explicitly state Azure and other cloud services growth (constant currency) <= 25%. If only reported in nominal terms, this prediction is unresolvable.
evidence: Microsoft signaled slowing cloud growth and cautious margin outlook amid AI capex (CNBC, 2026-01-28).
monitoring_signals: Microsoft quarterly disclosures of Azure growth (reported and constant currency).
Enterprise IT spending surveys and cloud optimization commentary.
AI infrastructure supply constraints and related capex guidance
predictions.rationale: Recent reporting emphasizes decelerating cloud growth and AI-capex pressure; that backdrop makes a <=25% constant-currency Azure growth print more likely than a re-acceleration.

predictions.text: Amazon will publicly announce an additional round of layoffs totaling at least 5,000 roles (incremental to the ~16,000 cut reported on 2026-01-28) by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if Amazon (or credible wire services citing Amazon) states a new headcount reduction of >=5,000 employees after 2026-01-28 and on/before 2026-06-30 (UTC).
evidence: Amazon cut about 16,000 roles, signaling ongoing restructuring and cost discipline (Reuters, 2026-01-28).
monitoring_signals: Amazon HR notices, WARN filings, and internal memo reporting by major outlets.
Quarterly opex guidance and segment margin commentary.
Broader big-tech layoff trackers and hiring trends
predictions.rationale: Large, multi-wave restructurings often continue for several quarters, but Amazon may pause if retail/ads/cloud trends improve; hence below-50% confidence.

predictions.text: ICE Brent crude front-month futures will settle at or above $95.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if ICE settlement data show Brent front-month futures daily settle price >= 95.00 USD/bbl at least once on/before 2026-04-30 (UTC).
evidence: Regional conflict risk premiums and shipping/security concerns are rising (NYT, 2026-01-28).
Venezuela output ambitions remain uncertain and capital-intensive (CNBC, 2026-01-28).
monitoring_signals: Brent time spreads, implied vol, and tanker/shipping disruption headlines.
OPEC+ policy signals and compliance.
U.S. inventory data and refinery runs
predictions.rationale: Geopolitical risk can rapidly reprice crude; $95 is reachable if disruption risk or demand surprises skew upward, but supply responses could cap rallies.

predictions.text: The U.S. FCC will publish a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) or Report & Order that explicitly strengthens or adds orbital-debris mitigation requirements for satellite operators, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an FCC docketed NPRM or Order (released on FCC.gov) includes explicit new/strengthened orbital debris mitigation requirements (e.g., post-mission disposal timelines, collision-risk analysis, deorbit reliability reporting) by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
evidence: Research highlights rapid cascading collision risk in congested LEO, increasing governance urgency (ScienceDaily, 2026-01-28).
monitoring_signals: FCC agenda items, Commissioner statements, and draft item leaks.
Major conjunction/collision incidents or high-profile near-misses.
Industry/NGO filings in FCC space-safety proceedings
predictions.rationale: LEO congestion concerns are intensifying, but FCC timing is uncertain due to legal and inter-agency boundaries; action is plausible but not assured within 2026 Q3.

predictions.text: OPEC’s Monthly Oil Market Report (secondary sources) will show Venezuela crude oil production at or above 1.10 million barrels per day for at least one reported month by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if any OPEC MOMR (published on/before 2026-09-30) reports Venezuela crude production (secondary sources) >= 1.10 mb/d for a month.
evidence: Venezuela’s stated output ambitions require sustained capital and stability; near-term gains are uncertain (CNBC, 2026-01-28).
monitoring_signals: OPEC MOMR Venezuela secondary-source production series.
U.S. sanctions/licensing changes affecting investment and offtake.
PDVSA field/project restart announcements and export data
predictions.rationale: Reaching 1.10 mb/d is feasible if operational improvements persist and constraints ease, but chronic infrastructure and financing limits keep probability modest.

predictions.text: Tesla will disclose an equity investment in xAI totaling at least $1.0 billion (USD) in aggregate in a filed SEC report (10-Q, 10-K, or 8-K) by 2026-08-15 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if Tesla’s SEC filings explicitly disclose an equity investment in xAI with total consideration >= $1.0B (cash or non-cash) on/before 2026-08-15 (UTC).
evidence: Tesla reported strategic shifts including investing in xAI (CNBC, 2026-01-28).
monitoring_signals: Tesla 10-Q/10-K notes on related-party transactions and equity method investments.
xAI financing announcements and cap table updates reported by major outlets.
Tesla board approvals or shareholder disclosures
predictions.rationale: Strategic alignment is suggestive but transaction size/timing are uncertain; disclosures may lag or investment may be smaller/structured indirectly.

predictions.text: Micron will report High Bandwidth Memory (HBM) revenue of at least $1.0 billion (USD) in a single fiscal quarter (explicitly labeled as HBM revenue) in an earnings release, prepared remarks, or investor presentation by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if Micron’s public earnings materials explicitly quantify quarterly HBM revenue >= $1.0B on/before 2026-09-30 (UTC). If Micron does not separately disclose HBM revenue, this prediction is unresolvable.
evidence: AI-chip supply tightness is boosting memory outlook and highlighting HBM demand (CNBC, 2026-01-29).
monitoring_signals: Micron earnings transcripts for HBM revenue disclosure language.
HBM pricing/availability commentary from hyperscalers and GPU vendors.
Memory industry supply additions and yield updates
predictions.rationale: HBM demand is strong, but Micron’s willingness to separately disclose the figure and the ramp’s speed create meaningful uncertainty.

predictions.text: Google DeepMind (or Google Research) will publicly release AlphaGenome for external use via either (a) a public API with documentation or (b) downloadable model/weights/code enabling inference, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an official Google/DeepMind channel publishes a public AlphaGenome API endpoint with docs, or releases code/weights enabling external inference (e.g., GitHub + model card) by 2026-12-31 (UTC). A purely descriptive paper without access does not qualify.
evidence: AlphaGenome is presented as a new AI biology tool predicting variant effects, suggesting potential broader research rollout (ScienceNews, 2026-01-29).
monitoring_signals: DeepMind/Google Research blog posts and GitHub repositories.
Google Cloud product announcements related to genomics/foundation models.
Academic collaborations and benchmark releases citing AlphaGenome access
predictions.rationale: Google often commercializes or selectively releases high-impact models, but biosecurity/IP considerations could delay or limit access, keeping confidence below 50%.
